trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField"></xref> objects.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This class object provides the container for the fields of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>.

Accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Fields%2A> property of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> retrieves an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection> object.
The properties and methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection> class are a superset of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
All properties and methods of that interface, including those that it inherits from the ASP.NET <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface, are applicable here.
This class provides additional properties and methods to modify the collection.
These properties and methods provide standard collection management capability, such as adding, removing, and clearing the collection.

If you change the collection by calling the methods <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.AddAt%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.Remove%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.RemoveAt%2A> during Page_Init, the view state for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Fields%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Items%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ViewMode%2A> properties of the object list is ignored.
Adds a field to the end of the collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
Adding a field to the field collection of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control and requires you to bind data to the control again.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField"></xref> to add to the end of the collection.
Adds a field at the location in the collection specified by the index parameter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A value of -1 for the `index` parameter specifies that the field is added to the end of the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.
The location in the collection at which to add the field.
The field to add at the specified location in the collection.
Clears the collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.Clear%2A> method for all the classes where this method applies.

For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.Clear%2A> method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection>, it clears all the choices in the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.
Returns the items in the specified collection as a single array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListItem"></xref> objects.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The items in the specified collection as a single array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListItem"></xref> objects.
Returns the index of a field.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
In the second version of this method, it searches for a field with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField.Title%2A> property `fieldId` and returns the first matching field.
If no match is found, it searches for a field with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField.DataField%2A> property's `fieldID` parameter and returns the first matching field.
Otherwise, it returns -1.
A string to compare with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField.Title"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField.DataField"></xref> property.
The index of the specified field.
Returns the index of a field.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
In the first version of this method, it returns the index of the specified field.
If the specified field is not in the collection, it returns -1.
A field to search for in the specified collection.
The index of the specified field.
Indicates whether the collection tracking its view state changes.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if tracking its view state changes; otherwise, `false`.
The default indexer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection"></xref> class, allows the lookup of arbitrary capability values by index.
Any of the properties can be accessed by name.
However, the returned value will always be a string (or `null` if not defined), rather than a type-safe value.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The index of the item to retrieve.
A string representing the value of the field at the specified index.
Loads the previously saved view state to the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The object containing the view-state information to be loaded.
Removes the specified field.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Not available in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
Removing a field from the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.
The field to remove.
Removes the item at the specified index.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The index number of the item to remove.
Saves the changes to a server control's view state to a <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the view-state information.
Sets the array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListItem"></xref> objects as the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListItem"></xref> array.
Instructs the collection to track changes to its view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
After this method has been called, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property will return `true`.

Also, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> will be set to `true`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState(System.Object)"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
The object containing the view state to load.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
Returns either an object containing the ViewState changes or `null`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
